labels.analysis: The MCP-WORD Server acts as an intermediary that connects LLMs with external data sources and actions via a standardized JSON-RPC interface. Its core functionality involves enabling dynamic access to external tools and resources to enhance LLM interactions. The available tool (get_live_temp) suggests that the server can fetch real-time data (weather/temperature), but the description implies broader capabilities for integrating various external tools/resources for LLMs. This makes it a specialized server that facilitates third-party integrations and tool access.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "API Integration" was chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around connecting LLMs with external services/data through a standardized interface (JSON-RPC). The secondary label "Weather" is included because the available tool (get_live_temp) directly relates to fetching weather data, but this may become less relevant if more diverse tools are added. No custom label is needed since available predefined categories adequately describe the functionality.

tools.name: get_live_temp
tools.description: Get live temperature for a given latitude and longitude.

server_info_crawled.name: MCP-WORD Server
server_info_crawled.author: @cihantasdemiir/mcp-word
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide a server implementation that integrates with the Model Context Protocol to expose tools, resources, and prompts for enhanced LLM interactions. Enable dynamic access to external data and actions through a standardized JSON-RPC interface. Facilitate seamless communication between LLM clients and external context providers.

tools.name: get_live_temp
tools.description: Get live temperature for a given latitude and longitude.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@cihantasdemiir/mcp-word/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
